title: Once I open cmd using python, how to make it not close instantly?
author: t2_1o82nj5w
text:
I want to open cmd with the use of python, then make it run netstat and not close. 

    os.system("start cmd")

The above code opens cmd just fine and the window stays open. 

    os.system("start cmd /c {netstat}")

With the above command cmd opens and closes instantly.

    os.system("start cmd /wait /c {netstat}")

Again, with the above command cmd opens and closes instantly. 

How can I keep it open until I close it manually?

comments.author: shiftybyte
comments.body:
CMD's possible arguments: [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/administration/windows-commands/cmd](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/administration/windows-commands/cmd)

One of them is:

> /k   Carries out the command specified by *String* and continues. 

Use that..

    os.system("start cmd /k {netstat}")

comments.author: K900_
comments.body: What are you trying to achieve here, exactly?
